contentrichtext.text: {{infobox historic subdivision| |Name= Medina |HQ= [[Newport, Isle of Wight|Newport]] |Status= [[non-metropolitan district]], [[borough status in the United Kingdom|borough]] |Start= 1974 |End= 1995 |Replace= [[Isle of Wight]] |Map= |Arms=[[File:Medina.png|140px|The Arms of '''Medina Borough Council''']] |Motto= Floreat Medina (May Medina flourish) |PopulationFirst= 64,790 |PopulationFirstYear= 1973<ref>Registrar General's annual estimated figure mid 1973</ref> |AreaFirst= {{convert|28949|acre|km2}}<ref name=guide>{{cite book |title=Local government in England and Wales: A Guide to the New System |year=1974 |publisher=[[HMSO]] |location=London |isbn=0-11-750847-0 |page=61 }}</ref> |AreaFirstYear= 1974 |PopulationLast= 72,000 |PopulationLastYear= 1992<ref>OPCS Key Population and Vital Statistics 1992</ref> }} '''Medina''' was a [[non-metropolitan district]] with the [[borough status in the United Kingdom|status of a borough]] on the [[Isle of Wight]] in [[England]] from 1974 to 1995. The district was formed by the [[Local Government Act 1972]], and was a merger of the [[municipal borough]]s of [[Newport, Isle of Wight|Newport]] and [[Ryde]] along with the [[Urban district (Great Britain and Ireland)|urban district]] of [[Cowes]]. It was one of two districts on the Island formed in 1974 - the other was [[South Wight]]. "Medina" was an older name for Newport which has been preserved in the [[River Medina]]. Following a review by the [[Local Government Commission for England (1992)|Local Government Commission for England]], the borough was abolished on 1 April 1995, when a single [[Isle of Wight Council]] replaced the Island's county council and two district councils.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.opsi.gov.uk/si/si1994/Uksi_19941210_en_1.htm |title=The Isle of Wight (Structural Change) Order 1994 |accessdate=12 January 2009 |work= |publisher=[[Office of Public Sector Information]] |year=2004}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord|50.6830|-1.5401|display=title|region:GB-IOW_type:city}} [[Category:History of the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Former non-metropolitan districts of the Isle of Wight]] {{IsleofWight-geo-stub}}
